snippet: After showing signs of a financial turnaround in the spring, Sony said Thursday that it swung back to a loss in the summer quarter.
abstract: Sony reports quarterly net loss of 19.3 billion yen, or $197 million, compared to loss of 15.5 billion yen in year-ago period; cites dismal performance of film unit and box office flop of movie White House Down, which offset strong smartphone sales.
lead_paragraph: After showing signs of a financial turnaround in the spring, Sony said Thursday that it swung back to a loss in the summer quarter.

headline.main: Movie’s Flop Contributes to a Loss for Sony
headline.print_headline: Movie’s Flop Contributes To a Loss For Sony
